answers.answer: Sometimes people wont get a positive on a urine pregnancy test for a couple of months. It doesn't happen very often but it has happened. Have you tried requesting a blood test? That would tell you whether or not you have any hcg in your system.
I agree with alaysha,request a blood test,i would have thought your doctor would have done this already,demand a blood test,or even a scan this will confirm,somthing is going on.best of luck.

I went for 3 months without a period was not pregnant.  By the fouth month I found out I was pregnant through a blood test.  But I was only a very few weeks.  The doctor said that my missed periods were due to my thyroid levels being soooo low.  Request a blood test.  If still neg, have your thyroid levels checked.  All the symptoms you described are classic symptoms of hypothyriodism.
Thanks everybody! I've had my thyroid checked already. Labs all came back fine. I think next time I go in I will request that blood test
I agree with onlyme27 also ask to have your prolactin levels checked
already been checked. the doctor checked for thyroid conditions, prolactin, cholesterol, diabetes testing... All my labs are fine.

question: Hi. I'm 23yrs old and sexually active. I've missed 3 periods now (I never skip periods) and continue to get false reads on urine pregnancy tests. I'm also tired all the time, I've gained weight, I have breast tenderness, and cramping/gas issues. I went to my OBGYN and she also gave me a pregnancy test that was negative. She prescribed estrogen for five days to induce a period and that hasn't worked either.Could I still be pregnant?
title: Could I be Pregnant despite neg. test result?
